channel.title: [PI][Webclient] Access denied on applet?
channel.description:
Hi guys, so I've been trying to make a webclient for my server. I jar it correctly, the cache downloader works etc. When I run it on a desktop (or when friends run it on their desktops) it downloads the cache and works perfectly. When I uploaded it to a web host and try to run it as an applet, I get this error:
[code] Java Plug-in 10.5.1.255 Using JRE version 1.7.0_05-b05 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM User home directory = C:\Users\MyName ---------------------------------------------------- c: clear console window f: finalize objects on finalization queue g: garbage collect h: display this help message l: dump classloader list m: print memory usage o: trigger logging q: hide console r: reload policy configuration s: dump system and deployment properties t: dump thread list v: dump thread stack x: clear classloader cache 0-5: set trace level to <n> ---------------------------------------------------- Exception in thread "Thread-12" java.security.AccessControlException: access denied ("java.util.PropertyPermission" "user.home" "read") at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPropertyAccess(Unknown Source) at java.lang.System.getProperty(Unknown Source) at sign.signlink.findcachedir(signlink.java:150) at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java:49) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception in thread "Thread-13" java.security.AccessControlException: access denied ("java.util.PropertyPermission" "user.home" "read") at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPropertyAccess(Unknown Source) at java.lang.System.getProperty(Unknown Source) at sign.signlink.findcachedir(signlink.java:150) at CacheDownloader.getCacheDir(CacheDownloader.java:51) at CacheDownloader.<init>(CacheDownloader.java:33) at client.startUp(client.java:6825) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:41) at client.run(client.java:4364) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code] Obviously it means the cache link is invalid, but other clients that I've used are able to download their cache to the same place. Do I need to add anything to my CacheDownloader to bypass the security issue?

item.title: [PI][Webclient] Access denied on applet?
item.dc:creator: @hiloser12221 hiloser12221
item.description:
@hiloser12221 wrote:

Kodiak:

You don’t put your cache link in there, you put your client.jar direct link in there.

Where did I put my cache link? I have the client.jar uploaded to the webhost.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI][Webclient] Access denied on applet?
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

You don’t put your cache link in there, you put your client.jar direct link in there.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI][Webclient] Access denied on applet?
item.dc:creator: @hiloser12221 hiloser12221
item.description:
@hiloser12221 wrote:

Hi guys, so I’ve been trying to make a webclient for my server. I jar it correctly, the cache downloader works etc. When I run it on a desktop (or when friends run it on their desktops) it downloads the cache and works perfectly. When I uploaded it to a web host and try to run it as an applet, I get this error:

Java Plug-in 10.5.1.255
Using JRE version 1.7.0_05-b05 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM
User home directory = C:\Users\MyName
----------------------------------------------------
c:   clear console window
f:   finalize objects on finalization queue
g:   garbage collect
h:   display this help message
l:   dump classloader list
m:   print memory usage
o:   trigger logging
q:   hide console
r:   reload policy configuration
s:   dump system and deployment properties
t:   dump thread list
v:   dump thread stack
x:   clear classloader cache
0-5: set trace level to <n>
----------------------------------------------------
Exception in thread "Thread-12" java.security.AccessControlException: access denied ("java.util.PropertyPermission" "user.home" "read")
	at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPropertyAccess(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.System.getProperty(Unknown Source)
	at sign.signlink.findcachedir(signlink.java:150)
	at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java:49)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Exception in thread "Thread-13" java.security.AccessControlException: access denied ("java.util.PropertyPermission" "user.home" "read")
	at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPropertyAccess(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.System.getProperty(Unknown Source)
	at sign.signlink.findcachedir(signlink.java:150)
	at CacheDownloader.getCacheDir(CacheDownloader.java:51)
	at CacheDownloader.<init>(CacheDownloader.java:33)
	at client.startUp(client.java:6825)
	at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:41)
	at client.run(client.java:4364)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Obviously it means the cache link is invalid, but other clients that I’ve used are able to download their cache to the same place. Do I need to add anything to my CacheDownloader to bypass the security issue?

Read full topic
